page.title: 09Court Lodge Farm,Great Chart
page.content: Mr.Bob Goddard farms 750 acres,making Court Lodge the largest farm in the Great Chart area.The vast majority is used for cereal crops:280 acres for wheat,120 each for barley and oats,100 acres of oil seed rape and 50 acres of potatoes and pasture.The remaining land is used for his herd of Friesians and Herefords. Compared with the general trend in the area,Court Lodge is intensively farmed.Very good yields were recorded in 1984 with 9.3 tonnes per hectare of wheat and 7 tonnes per hectare of barley. The biggest problem to farming in 1985 comes from the E.E.C.surplus which makes it difficult to sell all the grain produced.
